Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.org should have a NuGet version/framework service equivalent to npm semver calculator" (#7828) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

NuGet's versioning can get rather complex. The version range schema requires an explanation that goes beyond just examples. 
Same thing applies to the frameworks. As an eco system we are trying to cognitive load needed but we're not there yet, and honestly it'd be helpful despite that :) 
Now the question might be whether nuget.org is the right place for that, but I don't think we have a better place for it.

### Describe the solution you'd like

A semver parsing service equivalent to https://semver.npmjs.com/. 
This would ideally do versions + frameworks because frameworks are a .NET complexity. |

Fortunately for us, @joelverhagen has implemented a very good starting point http://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/.

### Additional context

Our initial implementation doesn't have to be as fancy as npms, I think we should only focus on the:

* Find best match experience - https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.5.0-preview.2.6382/find-best-version-match

* Get nearest framework - https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.5.0-preview.2.6382/get-nearest-framework

* framework compatibility - https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.5.0-preview.2.6382/framework-compatibility

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep] RI dev to master" (#7826) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Package type is not apparent in search results" (#7825) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

When searching for packages, it's not discernible from the search results what types of packages I've found. In this screenshot, for example, the first result is a library while the second is a tool:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/547415/73307732-a7f55700-41d3-11ea-9046-c91c29c3263b.png)

### Describe the solution you'd like

Ideally, the different package types would be visually distinct from one another.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A/B test prefix matching on nuget.org" (#7764) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
⚠️ Do not copy this issue! This used a special A/B test process. For correct instructions, follow this process in the OneNote: [Rebuild the Azure Search Index](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FNuGet%2FTeam%2FNugetServer%2FNugetServerTeamNote&wd=target%28Operations.one%7CC674B49C-4CB7-4793-8890-A1E46E33FEB9%2FRebuild%20the%20Azure%20Search%20Index%7CC705999F-85D9-4A93-8CFB-161C393C56FE%2F%29).

1. Determine the live instance of the Azure Search jobs
    - [ ] "a"
    - [x] "b"
    - [ ] "c"
1. ~~Determine the new instance to be used~~
    - [ ] "a"
    - [x] "b"
    - [ ] "c"
1. Update the job and service configuration
    - [ ] ~~NuGetDeployment PR:~~
    - [ ] ~~Infrastructure build:~~
    - [ ] ~~NuGet.Jobs Config build:~~
    - [x] AzureSearchService build: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3385062
1. ~~Deploy Azure Search infrastructure to provision the resources and secrets~~
1. ~~Deploy Db2AzureSearch to initialize the new indexes~~
1. ~~Deploy alternative instances of the Azure Search jobs~~
1. ~~Monitor the new Catalog2AzureSearch cursors~~
1. ~~Deploy V3 monitoring to start monitoring the new indexes. If you are not rebuilding for an A/B test all this really will do is add an additional cursor to wait on.~~
1. Deploy AzureSearchService
    - ⚠️ The Azure Search Service must be deployed after all other jobs.
    - Release: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=552548
    - DEV
       - [x] USNC
       - [x] USSC
       - [x] EA
       - [x] SEA
    - INT
       - [x] USNC
       - [x] USSC
    - PROD
       - [ ] USNC
       - [ ] USSC
       - [ ] EA
       - [ ] SEA
1. ~~Change the default Instance name for job release pipelines~~
1. Wait a week.
1. ~~Clean up~~
   - ~~Stop monitoring the old cursors~~
   - ~~Stop monitoring the old indexes by deploying V3 monitoring~~
   - ~~Stop old job instances~~
   - ~~Update the [Secret Rotation excel](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/Team/Engineering/NuGet_Secret_Rototation_Status.xlsx?web=1) to make sure new secrets are there and old secrets are gone~~

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Surface Microsoft Application Inspector information on nuget.org" (#7824) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Microsoft has released a tool called [Microsoft Application Inspector](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInspector) to perform static analysis of source code to identify what categories of APIs are used. For example: networking APIs, file access, cryptography.

NuGet.org could use this tool to automatically surface such information about packages in the web UI. 

The output of the tool looks like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/73292749-74a4cf00-41b7-11ea-97c6-4ec56a3cb491.png)


### Describe the solution you'd like

For every package uploaded to nuget.org, run Microsoft Application Inspector on the source code (potentially gathered via decompilation or via the GitHub repository URL) and show the report _per version_ on the display packages page.

As a stretch goal, allow comparison of two versions so you can see leveraged APIs getting added or removed.

NuGet client could also show this information for an arbitrary package upgrade (and transitive packages pulled in) but this is harder since the analysis process may be slow.

### Additional context

Thanks to members of the Hacker News community for connecting the dots:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=22170705
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=22171263

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.org package statistics lagging" (#7823) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
NuGet package download statistics seem to lag a bit.

### To Reproduce

Just happen to observe a package before ( https://www.nuget.org/packages/Cake.Tool/ ) an event and it's been at 944,870 downloads for little over 3 days, normally it increases at least a couple thousand per day.

### Expected behavior
Number to go up over time.

### Screenshots
Looking at details it does seem indicate numbers are since last Saturday (Jan 25th).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1647294/73272603-efcfaa80-41e2-11ea-9a52-056db0d530ac.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1647294/73273378-2954e580-41e4-11ea-90dc-5d4e47358364.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing Icon in PM UI Details Pane" (#9113) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: VS UI

NuGet version: 5.5.0.6392-11-g0de9751d1

VS version (if appropriate): 16.4.1

Worked before? Yes, 16.4.1 5.5.0.6368

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open any project in VS
2. Right click and chose "Manage NuGet Packages..."
3. Click on a package from the list
4. See details pane

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1192347/73387922-26aacc80-4286-11ea-9a7c-1668de5f47b3.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "FireAndForget PM UI startup" (#9112) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The menu command builds the PM UI by calling JTF.Run blocking the UI thread. 

This is unnecessary. 
That can be made async. While that won't fix all issues with the PM UI startup performance, it will make it a bit better simply because now the UI thread is an async flow.

Related to [438211](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/438211/)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Stable part numeric floating behaves different from prerelease part numeric floating" (#9111) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The prerelease part seems to be treated as a alphanumeric. 

Related: 

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/1601
https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4513

Specifically for [1.1.1*](https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.4.0/find-best-version-match?versionRange=1.1.1*&versions=1.1.9%0D%0A1.1.10%0D%0A1.1.11%0D%0A1.1.20%0D%0A1.2.0) with 

```console
1.1.9
1.1.10
1.1.11
1.1.20
1.2.0
````

`1.1.20` is selected. 


For [1.1.1-beta.1*](https://nugettoolsdev.azurewebsites.net/5.4.0/find-best-version-match?versionRange=1.1.1-beta.1*&versions=1.1.1-beta.9%0D%0A1.1.1-beta.10%0D%0A1.1.1-beta.11%0D%0A1.1.1-beta.20%0D%0A1.2.1-beta.20)

with 

```console
1.1.1-beta.9
1.1.1-beta.10
1.1.1-beta.11
1.1.1-beta.20
1.2.1-beta.20
```

`1.1.1-beta.11` is selected


Note that for 

`1.1.1-beta.*`

with 

```console
1.1.1-beta.9
1.1.1-beta.10
1.1.1-beta.11
1.1.1-beta.20
1.2.1-beta.20
```

`1.1.1-beta.20` is selected. 

/cc @joelverhagen
